intro: Psilostachys gnaphalobrya, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its globular, showy flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in open grasslands or rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain the seeds. The plant is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
